item.title: Senior Data Analyst (Finance/Procurement)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, as advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

A key purpose of the role is to perform in-depth financial/procurement analysis, data analysis, and effectively collaborating & communicating with procurement stakeholders and senior leaders of CIBC.  The role will require the candidate to seek to improve existing processes and work collaboratively with various lines of business (LOB), procurement experts, operations and process engineering.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

Procurement Expertise - You understand the organization’s procurement process, contract management and can assist in financial analysis/business case development.  Identify ways to improve the operational relationship with a supplier.  Develops and drives KPIs & business scorecards for enterprise-wide reporting.  Develops working knowledge of the third party risk management process and requirements across the key risk categories.

Analysis - You\'ll perform both ongoing as well as ad-hoc analyses; provide analytical support to business lines\' strategic projects and initiatives; identify ad-hoc analytical opportunities driven by insights derived from performing ongoing operational responsibilities, including assessing risk, contract and spend data for Procurement.

Consultation – You are able to understand senior leadership business requirements and translates needs to technical solutions.  Collaborates and communicates with procurement stakeholders using reports and presentation. 

Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in management, engineering, or related field; master’s preferred
  • 1-2 years’ previous experience in supplier relationship management, financial services, or procurement related field
  • Experience in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, v-look-up, etc.)
  • Expertise in Alteryx, Microsoft Access and Tableau will be an asset

Who You Are

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered, go above and beyond, deliver quality results, and are not afraid to ask for clarification and guidance.
  • You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You are bold and authentic. You\'re passionate about developing yourself to bring out your personal best.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to build innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in you

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 14th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Strategic Development, ADA
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Director, Strategic Development, Architecture, Data & Analytics (ADA) is responsible for developing and driving the strategic direction across ADA. You will be working collaboratively with business stakeholders, technology partners and vendors leading cross-functional efforts to put in place strategic transformation and integration activities in order to build roadmaps and action plans for architecture, data, governance and analytics solutions. The Director manages relationships with senior business partners, maintaining continuous business communications with them to proactively plan and deliver business value.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role you’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Develop ADA Strategy: including the strategic roadmap for Architecture, Data & Analytics with a focus on building leadership in support of the continued transformation of data, analytics, governance and architecture solutions. Design and deliver robust business cases through their required governance lifecycle and report on the portfolio initiatives to the Investment Operations Board (IOB) including benefits realization. Manage pipeline and funding to determine prioritization for new initiatives by developing a framework to monitor, forecast and prioritize the overall work/portfolio of projects for ADA

  • Thought Leadership: Be a thought leader in transformation initiatives to optimize ADA’s capability, efficiency and effectiveness that would lead to key competitive advantages of our bank in the future. Leveraging a strong understanding of the industry, assessing market opportunities to establish a forward looking view that positions each team within ADA for sustained success with a focus on innovation and simplification

  • Relationship Management: Directly partner with business and technology partners to develop roadmaps and plans for ADA strategies; identify opportunities to leverage technology to meet business goals, increase efficiency and create robust platforms that support operational excellence. Liaise with third party vendors regarding potential solutions, assessment opportunities or proof of concepts

  • Strong Leadership – Well-developed management and leadership skills sufficient to achieve results within a matrix organization, including the ability to influence at a senior level. Lead and coach a high performing team of individuals. Direct, motivate, and develop the team, maximizing their contributions and professional growth. Share knowledge and collaborate to come up with effective solutions to problems.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate 5+ years of experience in developing imaginative solutions and new ways of thinking about situations, problems and opportunities. Comprehensive knowledge of the principles, practices and procedures required to develop best practice, knowledge-based business systems and strategic capability. Comprehensive knowledge of financial services practices and principles sufficient to analyze and interpret complex concepts and apply these in innovative ways. Understanding of mission critical delivery systems, including business resumption and contingency. Ability to apply these competencies within an integrated and complex business environment involving multiple vendors and/ or solutions

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes through your excellent problem solving and decision making abilities. You demonstrate team player qualities through your ability to lead and motivate others. 

  • You are a bold and accountable leader. You have experience developing and implementing strategic team goals. You have experience coaching employees and driving successful team performance.

  • You can demonstrate experience in strategy development, business case management and agile methodologies

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You have the ability to analyze data and reports with the goal of developing potential opportunities. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.

  • You have a degree/diploma in Business management, Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field of study, MBA is an asset

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do. 

  • You embrace and champion change. You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best, in a fast paced environment with a high degree of change and multiple priorities 

  • You’re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create shared vision.  

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability. 

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 21st Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Business Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be part of a dynamic team that provides advanced analytics services to assist Business Controls with effective risk management. You’ll lead the design, development, and implementation of actionable analytics solutions which help in strengthening the risk profiles across Personal and Small Business Banking. You’ll collaborate with partners from Business Controls, Risk Management, Product, and Frontline to identify and address emerging risk trends by leveraging data and analytics.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview

How You’ll Succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Full Stack Development – Collaboratively plan and implement client and server applications using modern web technologies.
  • Collaboration – Continuous collaboration with internal and external partners is key to success. Be open-minded, constantly acquire new knowledge, and share ideas to improve existing processes.
  • Communication – Actively listen to understand a business problem and effectively articulate data analysis and interpretation using language that resonates with your audience.
  • Consulting – Methodically break down complex business problems, deliver recommendations and grow solutions to create sustainable progress for our projects and programs.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in using analytical, data management, and visualization tools such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA. Knowledge of CIBC data sources/applications/ platforms is an asset. 3+ years of work experience in a fast paced analytics environment.
  • You can illustrate experience with Typescript, React, Node.js, web development and are excited to learn more about them!
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy wrangling large data sets and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You are a forward thinker. From building strategic solutions to writing good code/unit tests, you follow best practices with the intent of creating sustainable impact far into the future.
  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, curiosity drives you to go above and beyond, and you take pride in building trust with your partners through your work.
  • You have completed a Bachelor\'s Degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Engineering or related field or equal work experience preferred.
  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 23rd Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Advanced Analytics, Business Analytics, Custom Web Application Development, Data Analysis, Data Management, Development Tools, Identifying Opportunities, Teamwork, Web Application Development

item.title: Sr. Manager, Cards Analytics & Insights
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Director, Cards Analytics & Insights the Senior Manager – Cards Analytics & Insights will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting the Cards business within Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – you will combine analytical work with domain knowledge to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth.
  • Analytics – identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends; proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

Job Location

Toronto-33 Yonge Street, 7th

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Risk Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

Reporting to the Senior Manager, Small Business Risk Management, the successful candidate will be well versed in designing, building and implementing account acquisition and account management strategies with a focus on increasing auto-approval rates and decreasing loss rates. Expert level SAS SQL coding skills are required to extract value from data combined with strong communication skills for presentation of risk-reward analysis to Senior Management. Reporting (standard and ad hoc) will require attention to detail and accuracy.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data driven - Actively work with other business partners across the organization to ensure that work is aligned to our mandate and objectives.   Lead and support in-depth client insights studies using SAS, and create an analytical framework to help solve key business questions and test hypotheses. A strong understanding of reporting, analysis and data mining combined with  practical industry experience is required.
    • Support the development of proposals/business cases for credit risk scorecards, system or rule changes that will enhance credit risk management performance
    • Conduct pre and post-analyses of strategy performance.  Provide objective and sound feedback on the performance of acquisition strategies.  Make specific recommendations to improve future performance
    • Build deep subject matter knowledge of (i) TTD adjudication system rules, tables and cutoffs and (ii) acquisition campaign criteria. 
    • Experience in Excel Pivot tables, calculations, graphs and charts is essential and candidate must be able to customize these as requested by team
  • Continuous improvement mindset - Strong focus on process improvement. Regularly identify, develop and implement operational process enhancements with the goal of improving efficiencies and synergies between internal and external partners.
  • Communication and relationship management - Lead and assist in preparing comprehensive presentations as needed to highlight key insights from deep dive analysis along with any recommendations that can be adopted to help address gaps or opportunities.  Manage a number of high priority requests to support management in order to support the bank’s strategy. Interact and work effectively across multiple internal teams, and establish a process to facilitate data/information sharing that ensures a consistent, common understanding of key client metrics.
    • A strong grasp of financial terms used in Risk as well as their interpretation is strongly preferred.
  • Critical thinking - Apply critical thinking, creativity and sound judgement to identify issues and opportunities.  You can sort through complex and ambiguous scenarios to understand root causes and make tough but reasoned choices between competing alternatives and opinions.  You seek to understand before proposing solutions and although you intuitively know something doesn’t make sense, you rely on data and fact to inform decisions and recommendations rather than opinion. Openly and frequently share your knowledge, ideas and views because you know your perspective matters.
  • Project execution - Own and lead projects from inception to execution – such as, working with all stakeholders across the organization to develop a holistic client contribution framework & assessment to the automation of the entire process. Stay abreast of industry best practices regarding analytical methods and technologies.

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience in at least 3-5 years’ experience and strong skills in data extraction/manipulation and statistical analysis tools, including SAS SQL (required); comfort with exploring how new and emerging data can be used; Knowledge of data visualization tools such as COGNOS, Tableau, etc. is an asset. Working in applied data & analytics problems in business banking and/or retail banking is an asset.  Experience creating Access/VBA based reporting databases is an strong asset. Experience is developing business requirements documents and solutions requirements documents with Technology is an asset.
    • The candidate must be comfortable with advanced SQL queries and must be able to use SQL to draw relevant data, integrate it and clean it in a data hub environment.
    • The Candidate should have an in-depth knowledge of how to work in SAS and should be comfortable understanding existing SAS code and developing their own SAS queries to pull, integrate and output data.
    • Candidate must be able to understand and interpret complex financial data as well as spot any anomalies and inconsistencies in financial data
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You have a degree/diploma in a relevant bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or quantitative discipline such as Applied Statistics; related banking/business/finance knowledge is considered an asset
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 29th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant – Data & Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What you’ll be doing

You’ll be part of the Program and Integrated Service Management Team (P&ISM) that delivers program management and integrated business service excellence across the Enterprise Real Estate and Workplace Transformation team. As a Consultant, Data & Reporting, you will lead the design, development and implementation of a data integration and governance process, collaborating with internal partners from P&ISM, HR, Corporate Events, Enterprise Real Estate and Workplace Transformation and with external partners. You will support real estate and workplace strategy and planning activities across the Enterprise Real Estate and Workplace Transformation team by leveraging data and analytics.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role.  You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote.

How you’ll succeed

  • Innovative Problem Solving – Actively lead the development, delivery, and continuous improvement of complex data analytics and visualization solutions. Focus on quality, depth of analysis, and clear communication of actionable recommendations.
  • Collaboration – Continuous collaboration with internal and external partners is key to success. Be open-minded, constantly acquire new knowledge, and share ideas to improve existing processes.
  • Communication – Actively listen to understand a business problem and effectively articulate data analysis and interpretation using language that resonates with your audience.
  • Consulting – Methodically break down complex business problems, deliver recommendations and grow solutions to create sustainable progress for our projects and programs.


Who you are

  • You can demonstrate experience in using analytical, data management, and visualization tools such as R, Python, SAS, SQL, Tableau, VBA, Power BI, Alteryx. Knowledge of CIBC data or corporate real estate data sources/applications/ platforms is an asset. 3+ years of work experience in a fast paced analytics environment.

  • You act like an owner. You thrive when you\'re empowered to take the lead, curiosity drives you to go above and beyond, and you take pride in building trust with your partners through your work.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

item.title: Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Senior Manager, Automotive and Unsecured Lending Analytics will be a leading contributor in the Analytics & Decision Science team supporting Personal and Business Banking. The Analytics & Decision Science team focuses on creating next generation analytics assets to enable data-driven decision making for partners in Product, Marketing, Client Segment and Strategy. In this role, you will lead analytics engagements to evaluate client behaviours and optimize business decisions related to product, campaign, pricing and other business areas. You will present insights and make data-driven recommendations to senior leaders to help identify opportunities to grow the business and better serve our clients.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Consultant – be a leader in analytics consulting – Integrate deep domain knowledge with analytical capabilities to deliver value to stakeholders, enable data-driven decision making and proactively identify opportunities to drive business growth (projects/business cases, acquisition/retention campaigns, pricing, channels, segments, products and process enhancements).
  • Analytics – Independently identify and leverage the right statistical techniques (descriptive, predictive, prescriptive) to extract actionable insights out of client behaviours and business trends (both internal and external).  Appropriately integrate of big data, business intelligence, visualization, self-service and analytical tools into engagements.  Proactively explore new applications of advanced analytics to innovate and build strategic analytics assets.
  • Technology – Leverage big data/analytical tools to analyze large structured and unstructured datasets, build data pipeline and visualization from multiple data sources.
  • Ownership – Orchestrate end-to-end delivery of solutions that meet stakeholder requirements and contribute to business success – you will think and act like an owner in analytics initiatives ensuring the proper identification and translation of business needs into analytics requirements.
  • Communication – Find the story in data and be flexible in communicating at varying levels of details for the right audience.

Who You Are

  • You have a degree in a quantitative field (i.e. mathematics, statistics, computer science, economics, engineering, physics, business) or equivalent experience. Advanced degree is an asset (i.e. MMA, MBAN, MSc, MA, MBA).
  • You are a problem solver. You have exceptional critical thinking, problem solving and decision making skills with demonstrated ability to independently identify and analyze business problems and recommend solutions.
  • You are proficient in programming languages and have experience using modern big data, analytical and dashboard tools (i.e. SAS, SQL, Python, R, Hadoop, Spark, Alteryx, Tableau, Cognos).
  • You have experience in building end-to-end analytics solutions involving large datasets (i.e. requirement gathering, data extraction, cleaning and transformation, statistical analysis, presentation & implementation).
  • You have working knowledge of statistical techniques (i.e. regression, time-series analysis, clustering, decision trees).
  • You are an avid learner who recognizes the analytics field is constantly evolving. You seek to explore emerging trends and best practices in the industry and are excited to share the knowledge with others.
  • You can be clearly understood. You have very strong communication and presentation skills with a demonstrated ability to clearly and concisely present information to groups and individuals at all levels in the organization.
  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it\'s the right thing to do.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.
  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.
  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-81 Bay, 25th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Sr. Consultant, Infrastructure Data Analytics
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

SR CONSULTANT, INFRASTRUCTURE DATA ANALYTICS - Outsourced Technology and Cloud Services

We’re on a mission to build the relationship-focused bank of the future and we’re looking for the passionate collaborators, innovators, advisors, and leaders who can get us there. Our distinct culture is built on a shared commitment to do what’s right for our clients, our people, and our communities, and we strive for excellence in everything we do. Because life at CIBC is not only what you do, but how you do it.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

What You’ll Be Doing

As a Senior Consultant – Infrastructure Data Analytics, you will be supporting the financial and contractual governance of our outsourced technology and cloud infrastructure services.  You will use a variety of tools and processes to create meaningful analytics from both structured and unstructured data.  These outputs will be used to provide effective decision support guidance for our internal partners and senior executives.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Data Engineering and Data Science – Must have an awareness of current tools and methods used to support data engineering and data science analytics to provide insight and decision support for Senior Executives and management within CIBC.  Determine strategies for data integrity validation processes, optimization of data throughput, accessibility, and error-handling for tools to deliver ETL solutions.
  • Evaluate new tools and techniques and make recommendations to improve real-time and batch data access, transformation and movement across heterogeneous technologies and platforms.
  • Identify opportunities for new initiatives; make recommendations for increasing scalability and robustness of ETL platforms and solutions.
  • Financial Management Expertise – Must have prior work experience with core financial management and accounting activities such as planning, forecasting, accruals, and financial variance reporting. 
  • Information Technology Outsourcing and Public Cloud – Must have previous experience with, and a working understanding of outsourced information technology and public cloud infrastructure.
  • Creative Problem Solving – Demonstrated ability to thrive in ambiguity, understand business context quickly and connect the dots. Must be comfortable operating at a strategic level and also driving into detail as needed, and back. Continuous improvement is part of your DNA.

KNOWLEDGE/SKILL REQUIREMENTS

Subject Matter Expertise:

  • Logical Data Modeling--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting conceptual/logical data models to capture domain knowledge and business rules.
  • Database Structures--Knowledge of a database management structures (relational, hierarchical., distributed...) and associated platforms

Extensive Work Experience:

  • Modeling: Data, Process, Events, Objects--Knowledge of activities, tasks, processes, deliverables and techniques for analyzing and documenting logical relationships among the data, process or events.
  • Accuracy/Attention to Detail--Ability to process information with high levels of accuracy.

Work Experience:

  • Problem Solving--Knowledge of approaches, tools, techniques for recognizing, anticipating, and resolving organizational, operational or process problems.
  • Database Structures--Knowledge of a database management structures (relational, hierarchical., distributed...) and associated platforms.
  • Data Movement Tools--Knowledge of tools, techniques and practices for movement of electronic data.

Who You Are

  • You understand that success is in the details. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.
  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home
  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity
  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning and comprehensive product training
  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What You Need to Know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com
  • You need to be legally eligible to work in Canada at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

This is a regular full time role with a schedule of 37.5 hours each week.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-483 Bay St, 5th floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Director, Application Development (Data Analytics & Reporting)
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

You’ll be joining CIBC’s Private Wealth Management (PWM) Technology group within Wealth Management and will be an integral part of CIBC’s technology transformation. As the Director, Application Development, you will act as the technical subject matter expert with oversight and accountability for Business Analysis, Production Support, Development, QA and Vendor Relations for the Data Analytics & Reporting applications and services supporting the Private Wealth Management business group. With a strong focus on technology strategy, delivery approaches and business acumen, you’ll lead a team delivering technology changes and supporting requirements that align with both the Private Wealth Management line of business and the Wealth Management Technology (WMT) mandates.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical Leadership – Drive PWM technology solutions with respect to Data Analytics & Reporting as part of an integrated business and technology roadmap. Design, develop, implement/execute and support technology strategies which include:  Data and Business Analytics strategy, Cloud strategy, Application Modernization/CCR strategy, Application Health-check and Innovation strategy, Process Automation (QA), DevOps adoption.  Provide oversight and leadership of end to end technology solutions involving development, business analysis, QA, vendor relations, production support and development functions supporting the business to meet their objectives.

  • People Leadership – Lead and coach a team of Business Systems Analysts, Application Developers, and Application Support Specialists building on existing individual capabilities and bringing new talent into the team to meet business and technology objectives. Develop your team, maximizing their contributions, encourage out of the box thinking and professional growth. Create a positive work environment through being an effective role model and by championing CIBC’s mission, vision and values, ensuring compliance with policies, standards, guidelines and controls, applying policies fairly and consistently so employees understand what to expect. Manage performance by providing fair and accurate formal and informal feedback, identifying and removing obstacles to performance and by explaining how performance expectations align with business priorities.

  • Relationship Management – Work closely with clients and business partners to develop, test, plan and implement application enhancements. Become familiar for all CIBC enterprise development practices, standards and governance controls for other CIBC groups and technology vendors. Advise on emerging technical trends in the industry and at CIBC, and ensure application services best practices reflect appropriate technological developments for a competitive business position.  Collaborate and support the other PWM Technology teams in the delivery of technology modernization that address the strategic and operational business partner agenda and the CIBC technology strategy.  Analyze technical risk to support business recommendations and make adjustments to internal operations as necessary to improve performance of the Application Delivery and support teams. 

 

Who You Are

  • You can demonstrate experience with: 8+ years\' experience leading, designing, developing, implementing and supporting both in house applications as well as vendor developed and ASP. You have led the creation of a data strategy and associated roadmap and led execution across multiple technologies and projects. Experience in most of the following: Languages (Net, C#, C/C++, Foxpro, Python, Java, Javascript), Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, Sybase), Cloud (Azure, AWS), ETL (Informatica, SSIS), O/S (Sun Solaris, Microsoft Windows), Schedulers etc. (Feedhub, MFTS, Autosys) and Tools (source control/issue management: Git, TFS, JIRA, Azure DevOps), Data and Business Analytics, Application Modernization/CCR, Application Health-check and Innovation, Process Automation (QA) and DevOps adoption. You will utilize your breadth of knowledge to identify opportunities to optimize, modernize, retire or consolidate a large number of applications spanning numerous technologies. You are a seasoned people leader with the ability to coach and help develop other team members. It’s an Asset if:  You have good understanding of the Wealth Management business and have worked in a capacity supporting the business. You have a degree/diploma in: Computer Science, Engineering, and/or a related field.

  • You have a solid understanding of: Managing vendor applications, roadmaps, testing, and implementation. Designing and implementing applications for cloud. Strong knowledge of Agile methodology and experience working in a Scrum team.

  • Your influence makes an impact. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.

  • You embrace and champion change: You’ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best.  You empower and enable your team to make continuous improvement, go above and beyond, and deliver results.

  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of a team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto 55 Yonge Street, 2nd

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

item.title: Consultant, Business Systems Analysis
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

As a Business Systems Consultant you will be responsible for providing management reporting and business analytics to support IT Senior Management. This includes creating and delivering regular and ad hoc reports as well as conducting analysis to support business decisions and initiatives

How You\'ll Succeed

  • Data Analytics & Reporting: Gather key business metrics that will support management and risk reports on a regular basis. Perform business analysis to support business decisions and initiatives.  Provide Information Governance by maintaining a Metric Dictionary and calendar of key deliverables
  • Understanding and Documenting Requirements - Work closely with business partners to gather complex business requirements and facilitate solution design discussions to ensure you meet project needs. Build strong relationships, lead discussions, listen and ask the right questions to ensure solutions meet requirements.
  • Leading and Mentoring – Support technology project implementation as a data subject matter expert, and provide guidance to a diverse team of technology and project professionals. Maintain a collaborative work environment and support team members to resolve organizational, operational, and process problems.

Who You Are

  • You put our clients first. You engage with purpose to find the right solutions. You go the extra mile, because it’s the right thing to do.
  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems, and making sense of information. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way.
  • You\'re driven by collective success and your influence makes an impact. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to create a shared vision. You know that relationships and networks are essential to success. You inspire outcomes by making yourself heard.
  • You have strong business acumen, including 4 to 8 years of working experience, preferably with 2 years of consulting experience. A university degree is required (Engineering, Computer Science or Business preferred) with an MBA being nice to have. A developed working knowledge of the IT industry is essential. Operations Risk experience is an asset.
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.  

Job Location

Toronto-CC East 11th Floor

Employment Type

Regular

Weekly Hours

37.5

Skills

Agile Methodologies, Change Management, Data Analytics (Inactive), Demonstrating Business Acumen (Inactive), Driving Vision and Purpose (Inactive), ITIL (Inactive), Management Consulting, Managing Relationships (Inactive), Microsoft PowerPoint, Microsoft Project, Microsoft Visio, Microsoft Word, Problem Solving, Taking a Global Perspective (Inactive)

item.title: Sr. Retail Credit Risk Manager
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You’ll Be Doing

The Optimization Model Development team is responsible for the design and development of data-driven credit risk management strategies for all stages of the retail credit life cycle. Reporting to the Director, Optimization Model Development, the Senior Manager, Optimization Modeling will be tasked with developing advanced statistical models that evaluate credit risk across a variety of retail credit portfolios including credit cards, personal loans and lines of credit, residential mortgages, small business loans, and collections. The incumbent will be able to lead the development of optimization projects from beginning to end and propose innovative solutions to technical problems. Also, the successful candidate will write technical model documentation to support the model vetting and validation process. Additionally, the Senior Manager, Optimization Modeling will need to engage with various partner units to understand business problems and to present key results to senior management. The incumbent will use statistical software such as SAS Enterprise Guide, SAS Enterprise Miner, and FICO Decision Optimizer to develop various predictive models and optimization models, conduct supplemental statistical analyses and provide statistical modeling expertise.

How You’ll Succeed

  • Technical expertise. Develop and execute statistical/machine learning models for all retail risk systems. Understand and generate critical actionable insights from data.

  • Innovation and problem solving. Develop optimal strategies to respond proactively and reactively to market situation and new business opportunities.

  • Effective communication. Engage with business partners to understand business needs and develop suitable modeling and analytics solutions. Communicate essential results, implications, and insights to senior management.

Who You Are

  • You give meaning to data. You enjoy investigating complex problems and making sense of information, while proactively proposing innovative solutions. You\'re confident in your ability to communicate detailed information in an impactful way

  • You can demonstrate experience in  modeling, including at least 5 years of relevant work experience with cleaning, merging, modeling and extracting insights from the data and partnering with business subject matter experts. You can also demonstrate expertise in SAS or other advanced data modeling tools. Experience of retail credit risk is a big asset asset. Knowledge of FICO Decision Optimizer is also an asset.

  • You have a graduate degree in areas with exposure to statistical or machine learning coursework (Statistics, Math, Analytics, Economics, Engineering, Data Science).

  • You love to learn. You\'re passionate about growing your knowledge, and you know that there is no limit to what you can achieve

  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You notice things that others don\'t. Your critical thinking skills help to inform your decision making.

  • You engage with your heart and mind. You care about people and understand different perspectives. You listen and learn from the experiences of others.

  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values – trust, teamwork and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, our people are our greatest asset. You’ll become part of a diverse community that acknowledges everyone’s unique talents, and empowers teams to do what’s right for the client, and to do it well. As part of our team, you will:

  • Thrive: Benefit from an open and approachable culture that provides the flexibility and support you need to integrate your life at work and at home.

  • Connect: Work in a place where the right technology and infrastructure fosters innovation, collaboration and creativity.

  • Develop: Grow your skills and career through our best-in-class onboarding experience, ongoing learning opportunities, individual development planning, and comprehensive product training.

  • Prosper: Share in our collective success with a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, health benefits program, and employee share purchase plan.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

item.title: Sr. UX Strategist
item.description:
We’re building a relationship-oriented bank for the modern world. We need talented, passionate professionals who are dedicated to doing what’s right for our clients.

At CIBC, we embrace your strengths and your ambitions, so you are empowered at work. Our team members have what they need to make a meaningful impact and are truly valued for who they are and what they contribute.

To learn more about CIBC, please visit CIBC.com

Job Description

What You\'ll Be Doing

You’ll work on the Frontline Technology Strategy User Experience (UX) team which is responsible for conceptualizing and designing UX for employee-facing software applications. You’ll partner with other units across the bank to shape and communicate user experience strategies and design, often serving as the team advisor responsible for defining the overall UX vision throughout the digital ecosystem. You’ll apply an user-centred design approach by using various Research methods while integrating Design Thinking, Strategic Foresight and Analytics in order to fulfill the needs of the Business.  You’ll present recommendations to stakeholders and executives based on data, user feedback and insights collected to support with strategic decision making that support a long-term vision.

At CIBC we enable the work environment most optimal for you to thrive in your role. You’ll have the flexibility to manage your work activities within a hybrid work arrangement where you’ll spend 1-3 days per week on-site, while other days will be remote. Details on your work arrangement (proportion of on-site and remote work) will be discussed at the time of your interview.

How You’ll Succeed

  • UX Strategy – You’ll work with stakeholders and other members of the Frontline UX Team to give valuable input and recommendations to key business decisions with an user-centered mindset. You’ll help define an UX Vision and an UX Roadmap for our direct organization using Strategic Foresight. You’ll leverage core themes and findings from UX Research activities and communicate it to the Business for impactful and meaningful short, medium and long-term strategic decisions, while supporting with prioritizing activities and working closely to the Innovation team.
  • Data Analysis – You’ll give meaning to data by connecting design strategy and business metrics. You will look deeply into human behavioral data e how it shifts among time to propose unique but adoptable solutions and approaches to form a robust UX strategy roadmap.
  • Collaborate - You’ll work closely with a multidisciplinary team to develop experiences for our clients and employees. You’ll build strong relationships with stakeholders to help them set a vision for projects, including framing the problems to be solved and defining criteria for project success. You’ll work effectively within constraints, understanding the broader organizational context but also being ready to challenge it when necessary.
  • Research and Present – You’ll promote UX research studies, develop Personas, facilitate discovery sessions, run design thinking workshops, and analyze qualitative and quantitative data. You’ll analyze and translate research data into meaningful insights and powerful stories using artifacts such as customer journey maps, videos and storyboards, executive memos, compelling reports, and townhall presentations that explain unmet needs and present opportunities for change in the future-facing and nearer-term experiences.
  • Teamwork– Promote both user-centred and client-centred designs to project peers in a collaborative way that supports Business Strategy. Establish and build healthy working relations and partnerships with stakeholders, Tech partners, vendors and peers to drive research-led design process.
  • Leadership -  Articulate business value of UX Strategy to stakeholders.

Who You Are

  • You have a minimum of 5+ years of hands-on UX related experience. Team or project Lead experience is an asset.
  • You have a degree/diploma in design and research such as Behavioural Science, Inclusive Design, Data Science, Industrial Design, Business, Information Studies, Cognitive Psychology, Product Design or related fields.
  • You\'re digitally savvy. You seek out innovative solutions and embrace evolving technologies. You are curious and can easily adapt to new tools and trends.
  • You\'re driven by collective success. You know that collaboration can transform a good idea into a great one. You understand the power of an inclusive team that enjoys working together to bring a shared vision to life.
  • You embrace and champion change. You\'ll continuously evolve your thinking and the way you work in order to deliver your best. You
  • Values matter to you. You bring your real self to work and you live our values - trust, teamwork, and accountability.

What CIBC Offers

At CIBC, your goals are a priority. We start with your strengths and ambitions as an employee and strive to create opportunities to tap into your potential. We aspire to give you a career, rather than just a paycheck.

  • We work to recognize you in meaningful, personalized ways including a competitive salary, incentive pay, banking benefits, a health benefits program, defined benefit pension plan, an employee share purchase plan and MomentMakers, our social, points-based recognition program.

  • Our spaces and technological toolkit will make it simple to bring together great minds to create innovative solutions that make a difference for our clients.

  • We cultivate a culture where you can express your ambition through initiatives like Purpose Day; a paid day off dedicated for you to use to invest in your growth and development.

What you need to know

  • CIBC is committed to creating an inclusive environment where all team members and clients feel like they belong. We seek applicants with a wide range of abilities and we provide an accessible candidate experience. If you need accommodation, please contact Mailbox.careers-carrieres@cibc.com

  • You need to be legally eligible to work at the location(s) specified above and, where applicable, must have a valid work or study permit

  • CIBC is committed to doing our part to protect our team, our clients and our communities. We want to ensure we have a safe and healthy workplace, and we want to do our part to get through this pandemic. In keeping with this commitment, and as a condition of employment, CIBC requires all successful candidates to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as of their start date, or provide written proof of a medical exemption, or other substantiated accommodation request under applicable human rights legislation.

Toronto-81 Bay, 23rd Floor

Employment Type

Regular

37.5

Skills
